question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Three specific things I learned include how Latinx and Asian communities in the U.S. experience similar struggles, how society often tries to label people as one thing or another despite their multiplicity of identity, and about how Brazil has the largest Japanese population outside of Japan.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

Also, I learned a lot more about creating podcasts and making interactive lessons.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I really liked how we had a variety of poems, movies, books, and articles to discuss throughout the class and how each week we focused on a different topic in Asian American/Latinx history. question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The professors were very engaged with the class and were always available to answer our questions. I liked that a lot of this class was group work and I liked when different groups led discussions.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I loved Dr. T and Dr. Sotelo and how they gave valuable context that helped us understand the works better and guided the discussions to be open-ended and let the conversations flow in many directions. The atmosphere of the class felt super welcoming and everyone was really constructive and collaborative in discussion. Grading is super fair and reasonable and I also really enjoyed the low-stakes weekly essays which gave us creative freedom to explore/touch upon topics of the week more in-depth.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

Majority of us have some sort of tie to Latin America and being able to talk about and relate to common experiences we have faced has been very validating. question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned lots about different kinds of Latin American music, political movements, and the story behind words like Latinidad or ones that are equally or even more controversial like Malinche.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: In the course, I developed critical thinking skills when examining labels and concepts like Latino and Latinidad. I learned about the history of the Latinx community in the United States and gained insight into issues like discrimination and assimilation that followed mass migration. I learned about the relevance of music in Latinx culture and thought about the many ways it can be used to express and explore culture.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
Coming into the class, I had some pretty big assumptions about the general content of the class. At first, I didn't think the course was going to center on US Latinx studies; I thought it was
going to focus on the history of Latin American countries and how those become affected by US intervention. Personally, I truly enjoy the direction the course is going. Learning about the history
of Latinos in the US, their struggles, their legacy, is a rich topic that I had previously not had the resources to understand. I've always wanted to learn more about this but I've never really had
the impetus to do so. I think it is so interesting to talk about these historical events, like the Chicano movement or the labor strikes, and tell my friends about them. It's a part of history that
goes unnoticed and it's worthy of bringing up everyone once in a while during a conversation. Outside of that, I feel like this class has made me more conscious of the continual Latino
presence in the US and what people are doing to combat injustice. I've done research and learned about powerful organizations, both in North Carolina and my hometown of Miami. It's
amazing seeing that everywhere there are communities like these all fighting for visibility and justice. I gain a lot from the music component of the course, and connect it to other music classes I've
taken at Duke. It's interesting seeing the connection between how the music we study is composed and what the music is representing. Understanding the Chicano movement through
song is a beautiful way to look at history. A song I particularly found touching was "Urbano's song". It was by far one of the saddest songs I've heard this year, and I still listen to it in my
 spare time.More concisely I learned:
- How to analyze Latino history and research topics in Latino studies.
- How to make a community facing project 
- How service learning can be used to supplement a class as well as engage with the surrounding community.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Professor Enriques was a truly a thought provoking and amazing teacher that really wanted to create the space for Hispanic students to have the option to speak about their issues, to connect, and collaborate. The class itself became a community in which we could talk about LGBTQ+, racism, prejudice, and our Latin identity. Professor Enriquez fully welcomed these thoughts and perspectives, allowing our voices to be heard and nurtured in a safe environment. She continued asking thought provoking questions to really understand our background and our place now. I would definitely keep the mesa redondas, discussion about the movies, and the zine.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Three things that I developed/learned during the course had to do with the Latino/poc community. I learned about the cultural competence and how its important for people who are trying to go into the medical field because everyone needs to be treated with respect and sometimes working with people from different backgrounds may need for different handling techniques. I also learned about the need for interpreters and translators. Finally, I also learned about the need to speak other languages other than English especially in this ever-growing country.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned that acting out of your comfort zone can sometimes be very helpful to other people and although some questions may seem intrusive, they are actually very beneficial to learning about people and their lifestyles. I also learned that cultural competence is not only learning to speak another language but engaging in that culture and that culture mastery can never be achieved. Lastly, I learned that a person in Latina America is in fact, American and that this term should not be used for only those in the United States.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about specific aspects that are similarities among much of latino culture and the vast vast differences that exist within it too (diversity). I learned about the inequities facing latino immigrants in the United States and how that impacts their ability to gain accessible and quality health care. I learned how to best continue improving my cultural competence of latino culture as to increase ability to work with latino people in our community with sympathy and an open-mind.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned various ways to assess the state of public health in Latin communities in the United States and all across Latin America. question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: This class gave me incredible real-world application of common health disparities both in and out of the US. A few main takeaways: learning about the social determinants of health, traditional medicine, and the Latino Paradox.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about social determinants of health in the Latina community. Through service learning, I learned how health and culture interact in the Latina community in Durham.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Specifically, I learned about the extent and dynamics of food insecurity in the country, and especially in North Carolina and Durham. I learned new vocabulary and correcting common grammatical errors that I was making. I also learned about many different service organizations both locally and nationally (such as TCG, Iglesia Emanuel, Root Causes, etc...) that worked to address social determinants of health.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned to speak more fluent and conversational Spanish through various modalities inside and outside the classroom. I learned more about the general health disparities that Latine persons face inside and outside of the United States, through various theories/frameworks but also personal stories from communities. Lastly, I learned how these health topics were related to the Latine population in Durham through engaging in and reflecting on service learning with the Latine community.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about social determinants of health from the Latino and immigrant perspectives. I learned about how where you live impacts the food you have access to and the amount of daily stress you are under from violence or lack of public parks. I also learned about the immigrant paradox and potential explanations for why recently immigrated Latinos are healthier than Latinos who have been in the US for longer. I also learned about service learning and the value of learning about complex issues alongside actual community engagement.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: In this course I learned the challenges and the barriers that confront the Latino community in the US and Latin American countries. question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: We went more in depth about the effects that immigration has on education, not just as students but also as professors and parents. I learned that service-learning can be beneficial to those who go and do the service because they're getting hours and experience, but it can be harmful to those receiving the service due to there being a lack of connection thus leading to a lack of understanding.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned a lot about race and its structural and material impact on today's society. question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: This course encouraged me to view world issues from a new, different perspective and has inspired me to continue my education in the sociology field. Specifically, this class taught me that racism is essentially the root of all issues that occur in the world. In addition, this class allowed me to develop my collaboration skills, a valuable skill that has always been and will continue to be used in my academics and beyond.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I gained a lot of eye-opening insights in this class. For example, I gained a vast understanding of the systemic hardships and inequities that Asian Americans have had to face in American history that is simply not talked about in American history. It was also very nice to have certain aspects of my own Asian American experience articulated, validating my experiences of racism and insecurity.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: This course served as an introduction into the social construction of race and how that's played an important role in defining the history of all ethnic groups in the United States. Throughout the semester, we learned about the different laws, social norms, and cultural movements that contributed to the development and continuation of racism. Most importantly, the class discussed the effects of said racism, and explored how they've continued to ensure white supremacy in modernity. Another important factor covered was the concept of color-blind racism, which fundamentally argues that today's racism is maintained through subtle means that appear to uphold equality.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
This course made me rethink the way I think about Latinidad:
1. The diversity (politics, intersectionalities, etc.)
2. Flaws and imperfections in social movements and the resilience that came in spite of that
3. Different experiences ( There are so many intersectionalities when it comes to Latinidad that you can't define Latinidad through one shared experience)

3) Various Latino social movements across generations

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

Among this, I learned about undocumented youth and their activism in Georgia, conservative movements within the Latine community, as well as queer communities within Latinidad and their organizing. These experiences were completely new ideas to me and I really enjoyed being able to listen to the stories of my peers and their shared experiences.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I gained a lot of eye-opening insights in this class. For example, I gained a vast understanding of the systemic hardships and inequities that Asian Americans have had to face in American history that is simply not talked about in American history. It was also very nice to have certain aspects of my own Asian American experience articulated, validating my experiences of racism and insecurity.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: This course served as an introduction into the social construction of race and how that's played an important role in defining the history of all ethnic groups in the United States. Throughout the semester, we learned about the different laws, social norms, and cultural movements that contributed to the development and continuation of racism. Most importantly, the class discussed the effects of said racism, and explored how they've continued to ensure white supremacy in modernity. Another important factor covered was the concept of color-blind racism, which fundamentally argues that today's racism is maintained through subtle means that appear to uphold equality.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1. I learned a lot about Latinx culture, traditions, and beliefs.
2. I learned about traditional medicine and its uses.
3. I learned about health systems in Latin American countries.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
-- practice with conversational Spanish, especially in conversations related to healthcare and public health 
-- specific research of Latino countries' health systems 
-- cultural competence skills including working with interpreter

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
One specific thing I learned was how to take into account multiple different perspectives when considering an issue.
Another specific thing I learned was how to demonstrate cultural competency in my daily interactions with other people.
Another specific thing I learned was the different determinants of health and how those can contribute to inequity.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned a lot about new perspectives, as well as how to apply the concepts in class to those new perspectives. This class also helped improve how I use my Spanish, especially when speaking on abstract ideas.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
- I learned about the different healthcare systems of Latin American countries 
- I developed an understanding of cultural competence and how to apply that as a healthcare provider
- I learned about healthcare disparities and how I can play a role in mitigating them

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I've learned various methods of how to apply skills learned on global health into my community and daily life.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Three things that I developed/learned during the course had to do with the Latino/poc community. I learned about the cultural competence and how its important for people who are trying to go into the medical field because everyone needs to be treated with respect and sometimes working with people from different backgrounds may need for different handling techniques. I also learned about the need for interpreters and translators. Finally, I also learned about the need to speak other languages other than English especially in this ever-growing country.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned that acting out of your comfort zone can sometimes be very helpful to other people and although some questions may seem intrusive, they are actually very beneficial to learning about people and their lifestyles. I also learned that cultural competence is not only learning to speak another language but engaging in that culture and that culture mastery can never be achieved. Lastly, I learned that a person in Latina America is in fact, American and that this term should not be used for only those in the United States.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about specific aspects that are similarities among much of latino culture and the vast vast differences that exist within it too (diversity). I learned about the inequities facing latino immigrants in the United States and how that impacts their ability to gain accessible and quality health care. I learned how to best continue improving my cultural competence of latino culture as to increase ability to work with latino people in our community with sympathy and an open-mind.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned various ways to assess the state of public health in Latin communities in the United States and all across Latin America. We learned about the unique health challenges faced by Latin American communities and how medical providers can become more effective and personal in their treatment of Latin patients.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1) I learned about disparities affecting the health of latino people, particularly in the United States
2) My Spanish communication skills improved due to the fact that this was a content-based course taught in Spanish. My vocabulary relating to health topics improved as well.
3) I gained experience participating in service learning for this class. This experience was invaluable as it allowed me to communicate with and learn about the lives of many people living in the Durham community, including many latino people.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I improved my spanish skills, develop community relations, and learned a lot about Latino health issues in the US

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned a lot about interpersonal communication and building meaningful connections with the Durham community.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: A greater understanding of Durham and the Spanish/ Latino community here.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: This class gave me incredible real-world application of common health disparities both in and out of the US. A few main takeaways: learning about the social determinants of health, traditional medicine, and the Latino Paradox.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about social determinants of health in the Latina community. Through service learning, I learned how health and culture interact in the Latina community in Durham.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Specifically, I learned about the extent and dynamics of food insecurity in the country, and especially in North Carolina and Durham. I learned new vocabulary and correcting common grammatical errors that I was making. I also learned about many different service organizations both locally and nationally (such as TCG, Iglesia Emanuel, Root Causes, etc...) that worked to address social determinants of health.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned to speak more fluent and conversational Spanish through various modalities inside and outside the classroom. I learned more about the general health disparities that Latine persons face inside and outside of the United States, through various theories/frameworks but also personal stories from communities. Lastly, I learned how these health topics were related to the Latine population in Durham through engaging in and reflecting on service learning with the Latine community.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about social determinants of health from the Latino and immigrant perspectives. I learned about how where you live impacts the food you have access to and the amount of daily stress you are under from violence or lack of public parks. I also learned about the immigrant paradox and potential explanations for why recently immigrated Latinos are healthier than Latinos who have been in the US for longer. I also learned about service learning and the value of learning about complex issues alongside actual community engagement.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

I felt as though the first portion of the semester was a bit lecture-heavy, but I enjoyed the latter half where we engaged in discussions over materials. I felt like these discussions helped me learn about the material, but they were also more helpful for me regarding my Spanish-speaking skills. I think I'd keep the small group discussions for future years because I found them really helpful and engaging.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned a lot about the immigration system in the United States, particularly about how difficult it is to receive citizenship in the United States. I also learned about ELS programs, particularly in North Carolina and how they are often inadequate. This class taught me to think about systemic issues and poor allocation of funding regarding education and immigration of Latin Americans.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Watching film and reading articles in Spanish, laws about immigration, and how the educational system works for english language learners

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Spanish speaking, writing, and listening abilities.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:

-I learned about different forms of language education models in the United States.
-I learned about the school to deportation pipeline, farmworker youth, and deported individuals.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: We went more in depth about the effects that immigration has on education, not just as students but also as professors and parents. We also learned about laws and issues that have affected immigrants since the US became its own country, and I found this really interesting because you can truly see how little by little, diversity is a little more celebrated in this country now than it was decades ago. I learned that service-learning can be beneficial to those who go and do the service because they're getting hours and experience, but it can be harmful to those receiving the service due to there being a lack of connection thus leading to a lack of understanding.

It was a super interesting topic as well as how we discussed banned books too.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned more about LatinX authors, the construction of a literary cannon, and the terminology LatinX.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: This class really expanded how I think about literature, especially the traditional literary canon in the US. Through the novels We the Animals, Catalina, and My Time Among the Whites I was able to gain a better perspective and learn about Latinx experiences in the United States. I loved the various media that was incorporated into the class such as movies, podcasts, and different videos.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: How to critically examine works by Latino authors, approaching conversations surrounding identity and how to be a more aware and informed individual, how to be creative while also listen/respond to others in an academic setting

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned a lot about Latino literature and how it's viewed in the US. It was interesting to talk about what gets published/publicized and why. I think I also just learned a lot from the texts we read. It's cool how much more you can understand a person/author's experience or culture just through exposing yourself to more literature.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I loved how the class was set up to be guided by us and our insights on each book.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I feel like she could make it a lot more interactive and actually have a presentation. She would just talk about a subject but actually seeing the slides would increase engagement and thinking.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I enjoyed the presentations and the opportunity to work during class on final projects.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I loved the structure of the course! I would keep the readings and discussions the same in future years as we were exposed to a vast array of work and it led to some very thought provoking discussions throughout the semester.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I really like how we had a more informational/academic style lecture Tuesdays and a more informal/conversational style seminar Thursdays. This allowed students to learn more formal elements on Tuesday which equipped us for discussions Thursdays. The professor was very open to new ideas and the classroom felt like a safe space to share and exchange ideas.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I enjoyed the discussion-style of the class. The professor encouraged all of us to speak and the students were very supportive of one another. The professor was also supportive when she appreciated our responses.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Very thought provoking because it forced me to think hard about my thoughts and the thoughts of my classmates.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: It was stimulating.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The pieces of literature we explored were so thought-provoking

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The discussions we had surrounding the readings each week were very stimulating. It was great to hear other people's thoughts on the readings and we were able to critically analyze them as a group.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The readings were very interesting and connected to one another. In addition, it was very enlightening hearing the perspectives of my classmates.
